alert.note: Alert for Howard (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 31 at 11:25PM EDT until March 31 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT FOR EASTERN HOWARD COUNTY... At 1124 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles northeast of Kokomo, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Howard County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
